prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Centered Hole Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.25). Sketch on Face 1: Create the first loop, `loop_1`, consisting of a circle centered at (0.125, 0.125) with a radius of 0.125 units. This will create the outer perimeter of the cylindrical object. The second loop, `loop_2`, consists of a smaller circle, also centered at (0.125, 0.125), with a radius of 0.0312 units. This smaller circle creates the inner perimeter of the hole in the object. Sketch on Face 2: Create a single loop (`loop_1`) consisting of a circle with the same center and radius as the smaller circle in the first sketch, (0.125, 0.125) and 0.0312 units, respectively. This circle matches the inner perimeter of the hole in the previous sketch. Extrusion: Extrude both faces in the direction of the normal by 0.25 units and with no offset in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.25 before extruding. Finally, join the extruded result to the previous solid body to add the cylindrical object with a centered hole. Part 2: Tapered Cylindrical Object Create a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0.0938, 0.0938, 0.25). Sketch on Face 1: Create a single loop (`loop_1`) consisting of a circle centered at (0.0312, 0.0312) with a radius of 0.0312 units. This circle describes the perimeter of the tapered and narrowed cylindrical object. Extrusion: Extrude the face in the opposite direction of the normal by 0.25 units and with no offset in the direction of the normal. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0625 before extruding. Join the result to the previous solid body. Part 3: Rectangular Prism with a Slot Create a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0.1453, 0.0938, 0.5). Sketch on Face 1: Create a loop (`loop_1`) consisting of a line from (0, 0) to (0.1007, 0), an arc from (0.1007, 0) to (0.1044, 0.0397), a line from (0.1044, 0.0397) to (0, 0.0397), and a final line from (0, 0.0397) back to (0, 0) to close the loop. This shape defines a rectangular prism with a slot in one side. The slot is created by the arc. Sketch on Face 2: Create a loop (`loop_1`) consisting of a line from (0.1007, 0) to (0.2892, 0), a line from (0.2892, 0) to (0.2892, 0.0397), an arc from (0.2892, 0.0397) to (0.1044, 0.0397), and a final line from (0.1044, 0.0397) back to (0.1007, 0). This shape is an elongated rectangle, also with the slot cut along one of its sides. Extrusion: Extrude both faces in the direction of the normal by 0.25 units and with no offset in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2892 before extruding. Join the result to the previous solid body. This final part combines with the previous bodies to create the cylindrical object connected to a rectangular hole by a thin rod.</description>
